name: Sheraton Agoura Hills Hotel

reviews.text: I traveled with my sister who has a disability. This hotel is disability friendly. The Breakfast at hotel was awesome. While it was too cold to use the pool while we were there, the hotel has a lift to assist those with disability in and out of pool. Nicely remodeled common areas since Sheraton has taken it over. The only negative was that the floors in handicap accessible rooms were very slippery, not great for crutches.
reviews.title: great service

reviews.text: The website says this hotel “exudes the soul of a boutique”. My impression was, could it be more soul-less? Upon arrival after a long drive, there is no valet to park the car. It’s a very big parking lot, and even at night, you have to search for a spot in the “north 40”, and schlep your bags through the cars in the lot. Fortunately, there was this really big grasshopper that appeared in the parking lot to give us a welcomed greeting (he must be on staff). At this point I really wanted to relax in the lounge and enjoy a cold adult beverage. Apparently there were many others with this same idea, but unfortunately, we were told the bar was closed (then why was there a guy relaxing at the bar with two big fresh drinks in front of him?). It seems to me that at this day and age, if you have customers that want to give you money, ...keep the bar open! We were, however, given the option to use the vending machines for a snack.
reviews.title: Could’t find the “boutique”

reviews.text: The location is nicely nestled against a hillside, and their Sweet Sleeper beds, thankfully, were ultra-comfy.
reviews.title: Mid Week Traveler

reviews.text: We booked the reservation through Expedia.com for a king size bed. When we checked in, we go a room with 2 dbl beds. We went back to the front desk and they immediately changed the room for us. The room was comfortable, had a mini fridge and a coffee maker. The surprise was that we had to pay $9.99 a day for internet access while all the other hotels we've stayed at had free access. The staff was very cordial and friendly and had free USA newspapers available for guests.
reviews.title: Be treated like family

reviews.text: u
reviews.title: Nice Rooms

reviews.text: Nice Sheraton in a good setting so it does not feel like a typical Sheraton
reviews.title: Nice Sheraton in a good setting so it does not feel like a typical Sheraton

reviews.text: Clean, modern and somewhat updated
reviews.title: A business event - catering staff is awesome

reviews.text: Suite was nice and large... nice large shower
reviews.title: Comfortable

reviews.text: I would stay here again as the people were nice who worked here... club floor breakfast was typical and fair at best
reviews.title: Good hotel with nice facilities

reviews.text: About 20 miles from a good outlet mall
reviews.title: Nice, Comfortable Hotel and a Good Value
Decent stay
reviews.text: Having seen a cheap rate on Kayak, I booked this late in the day and proceeded to check in within the hour.
The staff were welcoming enough, there was free parking which was a bonus. Prior to using it, I noticed the toilet had some toilet paper in it. There was also some human hair on the seat.
reviews.title: Further out than expected, but nice

reviews.text: The bed was extremely comfortable, however was so high off the ground, it was almost too difficult to climb into.
reviews.title: Comfortable....
Nice surprise in "rural" L.A. area
reviews.text: After settling in, I proceeded to the bar downstairs. There was free wi-fi at the bar, which should be promoted, as many hotels on my trip haven't offered this.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I ordered a Jack and coke for ~$9. After I'd finished, I wanted abother one, but the bar was unattended. After 2 more patrons arrived, the barman came back. He served the other 2 first, then poured me another drink. After I'd finished, the same thing happened, 2 other patrons that had arrived after I'd finished my drink were served first. I settled my bill and retired for the night.
reviews.title: comfy and quiet

reviews.text: I stayed 4 days because of a business trip. Hotel was clean, rooms were big and service was just fine. Ask for a room with a view to the highway - the mini pool in the back is quite but a little awkward. It was just what I expected.
reviews.title: Value for the money

reviews.text: Even it's nearby the highway the sleep quality is just fine. It's nearby Thousand Oaks and a good alternative the Inns there. It is also 35 minutes away from Camarillo Outlets, 15 minutes from the Oaks mall, 45 mins from LAX.
reviews.title: Great home away from home

reviews.text: I've spent the past 8 months in this hotel while traveling for business and now that the renovations are complete I think it is the best overall hotel in the area. The breakfast spread and staff is exceptional. The remodeled dining room/bar and outdoor seating is great after a long day. The location is set in the gorgeous hills of California and in a very quiet area compared to the other hotels in the area.
reviews.title: Good place to stay when in this area

reviews.text: The price was right, the service was excellent and the front desk personnel were so helpful and friendly we drove 1/2 hours to return to the hotel a different night. Glenn at the front desk in particular was most helpful given that we had loads of questions and needed directions etc. Teh only reservation we have about this hotel is that they charge for room wifi. It is free in the lobby and because we are constantly traveling we need to keep up with our business and would prefer to do that for free from our room like we did in every other hotel. The cost is minimal yet is seems unnecessary for them to charge.
reviews.title: A good night's rest and more

reviews.text: Our stay at his hotel was quite enjoyable. It's very convenient for travelers on highway 101 and as other reviews have mentioned, the beds are very comfortable. Our room was clean and nicely decorated. Not much of a view overlooking the hotel roof, but no big deal. Hallway carpeting can give you vertigo, but otherwise the place is nicely kept and the pool and jacuzzi area were also very well maintained. Staff was very friendly and ready to help with any problems. Room service and in - house meals were great. There are also lots of other casual dining and fast food options nearby, within easy driving distance from the hotel.
reviews.title: Great for business trips.

description: Located in the Santa Monica Hills, our hotel has breathtaking views in every direction. If you're planning an event in the area, check out our meeting rooms, banquet space, and ballrooms.
